result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Ryan Gifford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Ryan Gifford in court with attorney May Y Lee.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense previously filed Motion for Funding of Expert.  Court grants request and advises it is to be a maximum of $5,000.00 and Defendant is required to repay Milwaukee County $150.00 per month commencing upon conclusion of case.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.  Order signed and filed this date.  Court expects an expert update on the next court date.  
  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Motion to Seal Defendant's Motion for Expert Funding received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Motion for Expert Funding received and filed.  bm

Defendant Christopher Ryan Gifford in court with attorney May Y Lee.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense requests adjourned date to review discovery and speak to the detective.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Christopher Ryan Gifford in court with Attorney May Y Lee.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective N. Johnson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Notice of Retainer.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Christopher Ryan Gifford in court, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Court orally ordered defendant not use any social media apps

Defendant Christopher Ryan Gifford in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Christopher Ryan Gifford in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Ryan Gifford appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
